intro: Eleocharis dichotoma, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that bear dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually green or reddish and are surrounded by bracts. Eleocharis dichotoma plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
